page.title: 19Tourism 5
page.content: { Kinderland}opened in May 1985 on the site of former allotments. The land belongs to the Council and is on long lease. It is essentially for under 14 year olds. "Girl Fridays" supervise the children who enjoy an indoor ball-pool, roller-skating rink, giant chess and draughts, and a water-chute. Redwood timber buildings tone with the surroundings. A cafeteria provides fast-food and children's menus. There is also a picnic area. Admission is two pounds per person for up to ten hours. Visitors there expressed approval of all the facilities.
